main event: Two observers reported seeing a bright, glowing, oval-shaped object moving slowly across the sky near Linconville, Illinois on June 7, 1954. The object hovered for several minutes before accelerating and disappearing from view.
interesting points: The object was approximately 25-30 feet in diameter and surrounded by a halo of light.
The observers reported that the object remained stationary and suddenly disappeared from view.
The United States Air Force investigated the report as part of Project Blue Book, classifying the observed object as 'unidentified.'
The weather conditions were described as a clear night sky with no clouds, ruling out natural atmospheric phenomena.
The main witness, Mr. John Doe, was certain that the object was not any known type of man-made object.
witnesses: Mr. John Doe and another observer
